output.dependency: The first column represents a unique identifier for each movie, while the second column represents the title of the movie. It can be observed that the identifier directly relates to the corresponding title since the identifier is unique to that specific movie.

The second column indicates the release year of the movies and the third column denotes the release year along with the country. Therefore, the year in the second column determines the year mentioned in the country-specific format in the third column.

The fourth column contains the names of the directors of the movies and the fifth column contains the writers. The writings of a movie are often and typically associated with its direction, implying a dependency where the director may also relate to or have influenced the work of the writer.

The sixth column consists of the main cast of the movies and the seventh column provides an exhaustive list of the entire cast. Thus, the main cast in the sixth column is a subset of the complete cast from the seventh column.

Both the eighth column, which specifies the language in which the movie is made, and the ninth column, which indicates the country of origin, demonstrate a potential dependency where the language must correlate to the country represented.

The fourteenth column indicates the genre of the movie and the fifteenth column mentions the location in which the movie is set. There is a likelihood of semantic dependency, as different genres may typically be associated with particular settings.

The sixteenth column presents a description of the movie, while the first column offers the title. A given title often informs elements of the description, suggesting a logical relationship between them.
